definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: That is, if you are one of these commune communities, then you're just a small number of people.
sentences.chinese: 即使是公社，集结成的也只是个小众团体。

sentences.english: The snow on the pavement was compacted and has turned to ice.
sentences.chinese: 人行便道上的雪被踩实并结成了冰。
巴黎和北京结成姊妹城市。

sentences.english: Leagues are commonly made for mutual defense.
sentences.chinese: 结成联盟往往是为了共同防御。

sentences.english: Yahoo now has a digital subscriber-line partnership with AT&T.
sentences.chinese: 雅虎现在与AT&T就数字用户线结成伙伴关系。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, dislocation reduced in density and joined into network.
sentences.chinese: 同时，位错密度下降并结成位错网络。

sentences.english: The cow milks cream an inch thick.
sentences.chinese: 牛奶结成的乳皮一寸厚。

sentences.english: The two parties banked together to form an alliance.
sentences.chinese: 两党团结起来结成联盟。

sentences.english: Bring the fingers and thumb together as if holding a phallus near the forehead.
sentences.chinese: 将四根手指和大拇指结成环状，就好像握住JB一样。

sentences.english: During the cold night the puddles skimmed over.
sentences.chinese: 夜间寒冷，水洼表层上结成了冰。

sentences.english: Several small masses cold be connected each other to become one big mass.
sentences.chinese: 或数个小包块连结成一个大包块。

sentences.english: A and B both sides forged a strategic cooperative relations.
sentences.chinese: 甲乙双方将结成战略合作关系。

sentences.english: The Axis alliance with Japan in the East.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒在东部与日本结成轴心国联盟。

sentences.english: The tennis players were doubled for tournament.
sentences.chinese: 网球运动员被结成对子参加比赛。

sentences.english: I saw them frozen into slicks on the sidewalk and oozing down the sides of walls.
sentences.chinese: 我看到有的在人行道上结成果冻，有的顺着墙角渗下。

sentences.english: It forged brotherhood alliance with the Western Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 而且还跟西汉王朝结成了兄弟之邦。

definition: to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
to band together/to gang up/to stick together
to adhere/to attach oneself to/to append
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve
to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to rupture/to fracture/to break down/(linguistics) plosion
